intro: Oreosciadium lingula subvar. pusillum, commonly known as the small-leaved oreosciadium, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or rocky crevices. Its botanical features include a low-growing habit and a preference for cool, humid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
